intro: Cyathea hortulanea, commonly known as the garden tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds that can reach several meters in length. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its rhizome system supports the growth of new shoots, contributing to its vegetative propagation. The fronds are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and can provide habitat for various small organisms.
